This executive order is an unilateral attempt to break the Congressional log jam over immigration policy and represents a dangerous escalation of presidential power.  By executive order, the President is enacting legislation that he and his allies cannot jam through Congress.  Even supporters of the Dream Act should have reservations about this executive action for three reasons.  First, it is likely to polarize, if not enrage, opponents and also draw in potential supporters who are concerned about the Constitutional ramifications of the President's actions.  Second, it means that immigration, which is a third rail of American politics, is likely to become a focus of the fall campaign.  When was eth last time you saw anything meaningful said in a campaign about illegal immigration?  Finally, a presidential order is written upon water and future presidents, such as Mitt Romney, can easily reverse such an order. Such a sweeping change in immigration policy should be entrusted to the legislative branch, as imperfect as it is, and I fear that President Obama has set the debate back, not advanced it.  The reaction to this action is likely to make it more difficult to address this problem and probably will backfire upon those seeking entrance to our great nation.

People who don't speak the truth are sometimes said to confabulate, in the sense that they tell stories they deem appropriate to the situation and context, including attempting to please an audience -- they tell the story that seems to be the piece that is called for to make the situation work. They may not see communication of the truth as what the interaction is about -- in kids, it may be about getting a parent's approval, telling a teacher they understand (even when they don't), a cop they did it (even if they didn't). For some kids, retrieving the truth from memory is much harder than navigating the social context with a tale that seems to suit.

I'm not sure why grown-ups confabulate, but some of them in my experience are actually unaware that they have crossed a line from innocuous social lubricant to damaging deception, again, I think because for them the situation is not about conveying truth but about effecting a particular impact or result. Sometimes it even seems to be just about maintaining their own self-image. It seems they may not even be aware that for the other person, what they are doing is experienced as a lie.

Good point.  When you lie, you must remember what you said.  When you tell the truth, you can say the same thing over and over again without the story changing.  The fact that Romney is on every conceivable side of an issue is because he lies.  He can't remember which lie he told before.  Speaking of Catholic nuns, when i was little, Sister told us when we lie, we diminish ourselves in our own eyes.  This allows us to justify more serious sins.  I never forgot this.  I hate when people lie to me.

If this is how well written your book is, I'd can't wait to get myself a copy. In the meantime, I'll ponder the existential question: why does lying come to easily to Mitt Romney? It must be my Catholic nun upbringing, but I can never take someone seriously who lies so readily!

Excellent comment. As a native Tennessean-- a kind of sister state to Texas-- who now resides in Fort Worth, I can now see the parallels between these two states. FDR created the Tennessee Valley Authority in the 30's and brought cheap electricity to rural areas, flood and malaria control to a soil ravaged, timber cut country, but they still hate the federal gov't there as well... don't understand how they got there, and don't care to find out.

Texas doesn't need the federal govt., because, you see, Texas has already been built with the help of the federal govt. The space program? LBJ put a big part of it south of Houston. The military budget? Texas gets a huge whack of that. Bases everywhere, the largest US Army base in the nation north of Austin. Oil? Supported by 100 yrs. of govt. policy, including the depletion tax break. Agriculture? Price supports, govt. research and a lot of farmers, and farm businesses, still get paid not to grow things by the Feds. Interstate highways? Texas has thousands of miles of big wide, 4 lane roads with one or more two lane roads right next to them. Federal dollars for interstates, literally, paved the way.

As a child, I saw what Texas was and I have seen what it is now. The hated federal govt. played a major role almost every step of the way. As a young man, LBJ worked in the 1930s to bring electricity to rural folks in central Texas courtesy of FDRs depression era programs. When LBJ was a boy, there were no electric lights and very little indoor plumbing in the Texas Hill Country. Now, it is like a suburb of tech rich Austin.

Kids in Texas grow up hating the federal govt. the way kids in Boston hate the Yankees: birthright. Also, a legacy of the Civil War. Texas chose the wrong side.

Our politics is divided between those who accept the modern world and those who have not and who don't understand how they got where they are and don't care to find out.

To address a number of comments it is important that my position on the entire question of illegal immigration be crystal clear. The action taken by President Obama should be carefully analyzed by any who would seek to benefit from it, since it contains problematical language which could negatively affect an illegal alien after the two year amnesty period expires.

I am a legal immigrant, a fact I have written about frequently in the NYT and elsewhere. I arrived in the US on March 19, 1962, complete with all the required documentation, a job, sponsorship by my employer, and a place to stay arranged. The process at the US Embassy in Dublin took two months; today it is difficult for Irish people to enter the US due to changes in the law initiated by Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy in an effort to redress prior pro Irish quotas and spread those quota numbers to other countries.

I totally favor legal immigration based upon a demonstrated need basis to benefit both the US and the legal immigrant. Many millions literally are in line today coping with that process; a high proportion for many years, while millions more sneer at our laws and illegally sneak across borders, or illegally overstay visas. Where is the justice ? The President did not uphold the law by this decision.

Writers here have noted that registering for the proposed program could, if the applicant does not qualify, lead to deportation, or that it could do so at the end of the two year period, if it is ended.

I totally favor legal immigration based upon a demonstrated need basis to benefit both the US and the legal immigrant
---------------------------"

The unilateral act of the President in circumventing the prerogative of Congress, who have yet to pass a bill still in process, popularly known as the Dream Act, which has been considered and not yet enacted into law, which is at the sole discretion of the Congress of the United States, is an action by the President solely to pander to the interests of, and gain the votes of illegal immigrants, and those who support them, in illegally voting in the upcoming Presidential election.

That the President of all of the American people, including the 25,000,000 idle and unemployed, would so pander to a special interest group, illegals; note that word; which means they broke the law of the country in which we proudly reside, these immigrants, of the illegal variety, simply to garner votes, certainly does draw a line of class distinction in our country; that between the legal and the illegal residents of the US.

The circumstances under which these people arrived in the US did not then or now change from illegal to legal because of the age they were when they entered our country; whether hand carried or ambulatory, whether understanding that they were breaking our law or unaware of the law, is no excuse for being here illegally.

That many millions are and will, stand in line for years stretching world wide to enter our country legally, complying with all our requirements, are ridiculed by our President for complying with our laws, while he panders for illegal votes, is unacceptable.
